methods.description: Indicates whether the host is running on battery power. This can cause performance degredation.
methods.name: isUsingBattery

params.name: platform
params.description:
The current hardware platform.
                                          USED FOR TESTING ONLY.

return.description:
`true` iff the host is running on battery power or
                        `false` if not.  `null` if the battery status
                        cannot be determined.

methods.description: Determines the amount of swap/virtual memory currently in use.
methods.name: memorySwapUsed

params.name: platform
params.description:
The current hardware platform.
                                          USED FOR TESTING ONLY.

return.description:
The amount of used swap space, in bytes.  `null` if
                       the used swap space cannot be determined.

methods.description: Determines the total amount of memory available to the host, as from os.totalmem.
methods.name: memoryTotal

methods.description: Determines the amount of memory currently being used by the current Node process, as from process.memoryUsage.
methods.name: memoryUsed

return.description:
The Resident Set Size, as reported by
                 `process.memoryUsage`.

methods.description: Determines the number of logical processors available to the host, as from os.cpus.
methods.name: processorCount

methods.description: Determines the average processor load across the system. This is expressed as a fractional number between 0 and the number of logical processors.
methods.name: processorLoad

params.name: platform
params.description:
The current hardware platform.
                                          USED FOR TESTING ONLY.

return.description:
The one-, five-, and fifteen-minute processor load
                        averages.

methods.description:
Gets the speed of the host's processors.

If more than one processor is found, the average of their speeds is taken.
methods.name: processorSpeed

return.description: The average processor speed in MHz.

methods.description: Determines the time since the host was started, as from os.uptime.
methods.name: uptime

return.description: The number of seconds since the host was started.
